intro: Iria insignis, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, showy flowers that typically bloom in the early morning. The plant is an annual herb with slender, climbing stems that can reach up to 2 meters in length. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and have a rough texture, while its flowers range in color from white to pink and purple. Iria insignis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
